Dear Lawrence Michael Zolman:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
10/1/2024. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616)204-6992.
Sincerely,
Holly Austin, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12203 Financial stability
• (1) An agency shall demonstrate sufficient
financing, on an ongoing basis, to ensure the
agency is carrying out its programs and meeting
the requirements for licensing. A plan of financing
must include all the following:
• (e) An audit of all financial accounts
conducted annually by an independent
certified public accountant not
administratively related to the agency. A
copy of the audit shall be available to the
department upon request.
An audit of all financial accounts conducted by an independent certified public
accountant was not completed annually.

VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows. The one
CAP submitted was in response to the licensing renewal inspection report dated
10/24/2023 and addressed one violation for family adoption assessments not
being completed timely. The agency is in compliance with that CAP as all of the
family adoption assessments reviewed during this year's inspection were
completed timely.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The chief administrator documented compliance with the agency's previous CAP
which was verified during this inspection. No concerns were identified by the Chief
Administrator.
Financial Overview
The agency tax return summary, and financial statements completed internally
were reviewed. No concerns were present in those documents; however, the
agency did not have a financial audit completed by a certified public accountant. A
variance has been submitted for this requirement; however, approval/denial has
not yet been received.
Staff Interviews
The adoption supervisor was interviewed and expressed positive experiences with
the agency over the past year. No concerns were expressed.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency had adequate space and equipment to provide for the delivery of
adoption services. Physical CHRI and case records are stored securely,
preventing unauthorized access.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
Not applicable.
3

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
